com.google.code.objectprops
Interface IFormat

All Known Implementing Classes:
BigDecimalFormat, BigIntegerFormat, BooleanFormat, BooleanPrimitiveFormat, ByteFormat, BytePrimitiveFormat, CharacterFormat, CharacterPrimitiveFormat, DateFormat, DoubleFormat, DoublePrimitiveFormat, FloatFormat, FloatPrimitiveFormat, IntegerFormat, IntegerPrimitiveFormat, LongFormat, LongPrimitiveFormat, ShortFormat, ShortPrimitiveFormat, StringFormat, URLFormat
public interface IFormat

The IFormat declares the common interface of classes that can convert a Java object of a specific type to a String representation and vice versa.

Author:
Michael Karneim

Method Summary
 java.lang.String format(java.lang.Object obj)
          Converts the given Java object into a String.
 java.lang.Object parse(java.lang.String str)
          Converts the given String into a new Java object.
